Question: When you experience boredom, what can you do on television?

Choices:
A: watch film
B: play cards
C: play chess
D: read news papers
E: surf net
steps: Identify the context of the question, which is about activities to do on television when experiencing boredom.
Evaluate the options provided to determine which activities can be directly done on television.
Option A: "watch film" - This is a valid activity that can be done on television since you can watch films on various channels or streaming services.
Option B: "play cards" - This activity is typically not associated with television as playing cards requires physical cards and cannot be done on-screen.
Option C: "play chess" - Similar to playing cards, this is not an activity generally done on television.
Option D: "read newspapers" - This activity is also not something you do on television; it involves physical newspapers or online articles.
Option E: "surf net" - While you can surf the internet using smart TVs or through television apps, it is not strictly an activity that is done "on television" in the traditional sense.
From the options analyzed, only option A ("watch film") directly pertains to something you can do on television.
